definition: formal title of the Japanese prime minister
pinyin: Nei4 ge2 Zong3 li3 Da4 chen2

definition: Qing emergency cabinet set up in May 1911 to confront the Xinhai rebels

sentences.english: Blame was attached upon Prime Minister Laughton's Cabinet for yielding to the Russians.
sentences.chinese: 勞頓首相的內閣因向俄國人屈服而受到責難。

sentences.english: But he accepted the cabinet's advice. He did not send his message to Congress.
sentences.chinese: 但他還是接受了內閣的建議，未將報文公之於國會。

sentences.english: South Korea created a cabinet-level ministry responsible for gender equality.
sentences.chinese: 韓國設立了專門負責性別平等問題的內閣部門。

sentences.english: Council of Ministers raised the theater with "a" square tower "is" a stylish matching cherry finish.
sentences.chinese: 該劇院電梯內閣匹配方塔採用的是時尚的櫻桃完成。

sentences.english: Iraq's prime minister is promising the cabinet shakeup.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克總理許諾進行內閣改組。

sentences.english: Britain was the first country in Western world to establish the cabinet system.
sentences.chinese: 英國是西方世界首創內閣制的國家。

sentences.english: This opposition in the cabinet caused Lincoln to postpone action on the Fox plan.
sentences.chinese: 由於內閣成員的反對導致林肯推遲了實施福克斯計劃。

sentences.english: The president appoints and heads a cabinet of ministers responsible to parliament.
sentences.chinese: 總統任命和領導對議會負責的部長內閣。

sentences.english: It is a cabinet-level position with the rank of ambassador.
sentences.chinese: 這個是內閣級別的和大使級別一致。

sentences.english: The president appoints all cabinet-level government administrators.
sentences.chinese: 總統任命所有的內閣國務大臣。

sentences.english: Douglas believed that the northwest should have two representatives in the cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 道格拉斯認爲西北地區應該有兩名代表進入內閣。

sentences.english: Within two weeks I had filled the remaining vacancies in the cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 兩週時間裏，我填滿了內閣剩下的所有空缺。

sentences.english: He reshuffled the cabinet to firm his government.
sentences.chinese: 他改組內閣以強化其政府。

sentences.english: More on that news conference by Chief Cabinet Secretary Yukio Edano.
sentences.chinese: 內閣官房長官枝野幸男在新聞發佈會上還說了更多。

sentences.english: The origin of the cabinet system of Ming Dynasty could be traced back to the conflicting process between the premier power and the monarchic power.
sentences.chinese: 明代內閣制的緣起可追溯至相權與君權的鬥爭過程。

sentences.english: The president advised with the cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 總統同內閣進行了商討。

definition: to take part in an election/to run for office
to continue in (a political) office/to serve for another term of office
